an4.55:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Bhaggas on Crocodile Hill, in the deer park at Bhesakaḷā’s Wood.
an4.55:4.3: Then the Buddha got dressed in the morning and, taking his bowl and robes, went to the home of the householder Nakula’s father,
an4.55:4.4: where he sat on the indicated seat.
an4.55:4.5: Then the householder Nakula’s father and the housewife Nakula’s mother went up to the Buddha,
an4.55:4.6: bowed, and sat down to one side.
an4.55:4.7: Nakula’s father said to the Buddha:
an4.55:5.1: “Sir, ever since we were both young, and Nakula’s mother was given to me in marriage, I can’t recall doing wrong by her even in thought, still less in deed.
an4.55:5.2: We want to see each other in both the present life and the next.”
an4.55:5.3: Then Nakula’s mother said to the Buddha:
an4.55:5.4: “Sir, ever since we were both young, and I was given in marriage to Nakula’s father, I can’t recall doing wrong by him even in thought, still less in deed.
an4.55:5.5: We want to see each other in both the present life and the next.”
an4.55:6.1: “Householders, if wife and husband want to see each other both in this life and the next, they should be equals in faith, ethical conduct, generosity, and wisdom. …”
an4.55:7.4: say nice things to each other.
an4.55:8.1: They get all the things they need,
an4.55:8.4: when both are equal in ethics.
an4.55:9.2: both equal in precepts and observances,
an4.55:9.3: those who desire sensual pleasure rejoice,
